definition: to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot

sentences.english: No, he can't hear a dog.
The only thing I could listen to falling asleep was the crickets' chirping.
sentences.chinese: 我困觉前独一能听见的就是蟋蟀的啼声。

sentences.english: She sang her first solos in church.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在教堂第一次初试啼声。

sentences.english: I listen to the bird with my ears.
sentences.chinese: 我用耳朵聆听小鸟的啼声。

sentences.english: This young star made his debut in a Disney movie.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的明星是在迪士尼的电影中初试啼声的。

sentences.english: Constantly refining the rallying cry is part of brand management.
sentences.chinese: 经常提炼召集的啼声是品牌管理的一部分。

sentences.english: First, Peter thought he heard the meow of one little kitten.
sentences.chinese: 开始，皮特想他听到了一只小猫的啼声。

sentences.english: His cries were all too human.
sentences.chinese: 他的啼声是所有太人的。

sentences.english: The desperate cries of the miller and his wife woke the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 磨工和他的妻子的绝望啼声醒来了邻居。

sentences.english: The tramp of horses' hoofs sounds from the wooden bridge.
sentences.chinese: 木桥那边传来了踢嗒踢嗒的马啼声。

definition: to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
to go off like a rocket/to rocket
to hear suddenly/to learn of sth unexpectedly
cry of a crane or wild goose
